ratings.comment: He knows what he's talking about and knows the narrative he would like to cast, from a history perspective. He cares about his students and doesn't care is he's known as an easier grader. Happy Retirement Professor Dill!

Charles Dill is great. He has passion for his work and it shows during his lectures, which manage to make Opera quite intriguing even to those with little or no interest. I got a "C" but only because I slacked hard and missed the generous extra-credit opportunity. Go to class, take notes, do the listening assignments and you'll be set.
Great professor who clearly cares about Delta Blues music. Loves what he's teaching and you can tell.

I took this class for credit at first and did not expect it to be this fun and inspiring. Professor Dill is a awesome person. His knowledge about operas is astonishing and he lectures them in a very interesting way! The tests are fair, mostly come from his lectures so don't skip them! You will learn a lot from this class.

Chuck Dill is a great professor. The exams/ quizzes are very easy and there are so many extra credit points available that anyone can get an A. You need to go to lectures though because he writes everything on the board.

He seemed like a very knowledgeable person, and he was passionate about the material. However, often times the way he would present things in lecture did not make sense. If you have Andrea as a TA you will be fine! She explains everything so well, and is honestly one of the best TA I have ever had.

Great lecturer. He really loves opera. My problem was that if you did not take notes in class you were screwed for the exams because the powerpoints were not helpful and the tests are completely based on what he says in lecture. Not much work in the class at all, but I wouldn't skip lecture. Toward the end of the class I started recording them.

I really enjoyed this class. Charles made the topic interesting and easy to understand. As long as you show up and make an effort to pay attention to what he is saying, this class is an easy A; I didn't even have to do the extra credit paper offered to get one.

If you're looking for an easy humanities class, def take this one. You need to know lots of songs and be able to recognize them for the exam, but don't worry.  He was really interesting to listen to and would really get into the lectures. Discussions were helpful for remembering info taught in class.  Tests were fairly easy, but had a few tricky ?s

I took this class based off of his rave reviews on here. They're all correct! He's great, and the class was super super enjoyable. I was nervous going into the exams, but if you know your stuff you're good. 2 midterms, 3 quizzes and a final. He offers up to 8% extra credit just for attending an opera and writing a paper on it. Would def take!

A lot of Italian words need to be at least familiar with for this course as some questions in the exam ask the meaning of these words. Memorizing is very important. His lecture is not very organized. It is difficult to identify the important parts of his lecture that may appear in the exam. So just keep writing notes. Also, his voice is hoarse.

Loved this class and learned a lot from it! Easy if you attend class and write down what he says. Multiple-choice question exams only. He is clear and makes it interesting/story-like for easier understanding.
Loved this class.  Interesting if you like music, great professor.

Dill was an absolute joy. I had no prior knowledge of opera going into the class and had no problem getting an A. Must go to lecture and take good notes to do well but attendance isn't mandatory. Easy A

Lecture attendance is not mandatory, but since all the test material comes from lecture, it would be wise to go. Section is worth 25%, and both midterms and the final are worth 25%. The final was not cumulative, and an extra credit paper was offered - worth an added 10%. Dill is very approachable, and the TA Richard was awesome. Take this  class!

Dill's lectures are a bit aimless, but nonetheless pretty enjoyable. His tests are simple and not too hard. Lectures are mandatory, reading the book is helpful to reinforce the information but not necessary. Overall, good class and good professor.

Dill is arrogant. You don't use the textbook AT ALL. don't buy it, he says you won't need it. Need to attend lecture to get info.. take notes. Do extra credit paper, it's easy and adds 10% to grade at end.

Easy, interesting fine arts credit. I had next to no interest or knowledge about opera coming into the class, but his lectures were very helpful and engaging for non-music majors (he realizes this is the majority of the class). Go to lecture and the tests are simple and take 15-25 minutes. No reading, small amount of listening, stress-free class

I liked this class for the most part. No book required, so no readings. You should do most of the listening though & attend lecture because that's where ALL test info comes from. Tests are QUITE tricky (I study HARD) but with 10% extra credit (3pg paper for attending an opera)...you could basically go from an 85 to a 95 getting an A!

Not the most exciting class if you are not into classical music but a almost guaranteed B and a very easy A. The book is not necessary as long as you go to lecture and take notes. As long as you review your notes before a exam you should get a A. Even if you do bad he offers up to 20 points of extra credit, and each test is worth about 40 points.

It was the first time I almost wanted to cry when I handed in the final exam because I didn't want it to be over. Awesome class. No need to buy the book as long as you go to all the classes, the professor is a great lecturer and you will never get bored.

Prof. Dill is amazing! Go to every lecture and take good notes, and this class is an easy A. Exams are NOT hard at all. He is so engaging and intelligent, gets you interested in opera even if you weren't before! Offers extra credit paper that adds 10% (not just points) to your final grade, which is amazing! TAKE THIS CLASS!

Easy class? Yes, but the enjoyment comes from the open personality that Dill harbors. A very refined and knowledgeable individual, he always stayed after lecture and had no problem answering student questions.  An interesting and engaging course, provided you like music ;)

Professor Dill has an excellent grasp on the material, but occasionally has a hard time expressing what he wants to say.  He maintains the students interest and is very helpful.  His exams are hard to finish in 50 minutes and they are difficult in general.  Attendance and reading is mandatory if one wants to achieve an A.
Makes you want to go to class. A lot of people say this class is really easy but you actually have to go to class and study a bit to do well on exams, they are tricky.
He is great.

attendance to lecture and discussion is a must. take good notes and study them and the exams will take u 10 minutes. class is really easy. listening assignments not really necessary - just be able to tell difference between each opera and u'll do fine for the tests. dill is a really great prof and actually sparked an interest in opera for me!

Awesome!  I loved this class.  Give's 10 points of extra credit if you attend an opera and write a review of it - hard to do if there aren't too many operas but still an awesome class - the only homework was opera journals and listening - very doable for someone who knows nothing about music or opera
Awesome I love opera now
i've taken 2 of his classes and i love the way he teaches as well as his passion for what he teaches.
WONDERFUL class. i had no interest in the subject matter before hand, but dill sparked a real interest for me! plus, he's good looking. the man loves music and it's obvious he truly enjoys his job.
Excellent
really easy class and a really good professor.  one of the most enjoyable classes i've taken here.
An insecure middleaged man who excels at talking but sucks at listening. More interested in promoting himself than his students. A very easy (but useless) course.

This guy was really fun. He explains the material thouroughly and is very passionate.  His exams actually reflect what you've learned, no curve balls.  If you go to lecture and listen, you'll get at least a B.  Like any good guy, he'll give you a second chance, if you did poorly on an exam, to do some x-tra credit.  Take 105, its a good experience.
No Comments
Knowledgeable and competent enough as a teacher, but likes to hear himself talk.

Wondeful professor to take a music class from if you are not a music major.  He is extremely passionate about the material.  Exams are not very difficult if you go to lecture.  If you do not do well on them, there is an optional extra credit paper that can raise your grade up to 10%.

Excellent professor. Very interesting lectures, well thought out material, well prepared. Makes the connection between music and everything else very clear. Makes understanding music very easy--therefore, the tests are really easy if you pay attention, because you'll understand everything.

Basic class that is very interesting if you have any interest in music, history and society. There are three tests that are easy as long as you have leture notes. Everything on the exams is said in class. Reading is unnecessary. Easy but not that boring!

Very cute for starters. Even cuter when he's trying to get a CD to play in class. Extremely passionate about the subject--a boring subject to some until you take it from Dill. Great class for the not-so-musically inclined who want to sound sophisticated when talking about Opera and Classical pieces.
